description: Functions to convert from and to Arrow.

comment.description: Transforms a DuckDB Schema into an Arrow Schema

param_comments.arrow_options: The Arrow settings used to produce arrow.
param_comments.types: The DuckDB logical types for each column in the schema.
param_comments.names: The names for each column in the schema.
param_comments.column_count: The number of columns that exist in the schema.
param_comments.out_schema: The resulting arrow schema. Must be destroyed with `out_schema->release(out_schema)`.

comment.return_value: The error data. Must be destroyed with `duckdb_destroy_error_data`.

comment.description: Transforms a DuckDB data chunk into an Arrow array.

param_comments.arrow_options: The Arrow settings used to produce arrow.
param_comments.chunk: The DuckDB data chunk to convert.
param_comments.out_arrow_array: The output Arrow structure that will hold the converted data. Must be released with `out_arrow_array->release(out_arrow_array)`

comment.return_value: The error data. Must be destroyed with `duckdb_destroy_error_data`.

comment.description: Transforms an Arrow Schema into a DuckDB Schema.

param_comments.connection: The connection to get the transformation settings from.
param_comments.schema: The input Arrow schema. Must be released with `schema->release(schema)`.
param_comments.out_types: The Arrow converted schema with extra information about the arrow types. Must be destroyed with `duckdb_destroy_arrow_converted_schema`.

comment.return_value: The error data. Must be destroyed with `duckdb_destroy_error_data`.

comment.description: Transforms an Arrow array into a DuckDB data chunk. The data chunk will retain ownership of the underlying Arrow data.

param_comments.connection: The connection to get the transformation settings from.
param_comments.arrow_array: The input Arrow array. Data ownership is passed on to DuckDB's DataChunk, the underlying object does not need to be released and won't have ownership of the data.
param_comments.converted_schema: The Arrow converted schema with extra information about the arrow types.
param_comments.out_chunk: The resulting DuckDB data chunk. Must be destroyed by duckdb_destroy_data_chunk.

comment.return_value: The error data. Must be destroyed with `duckdb_destroy_error_data`.

comment.description: Destroys the arrow converted schema and de-allocates all memory allocated for that arrow converted schema.

param_comments.arrow_converted_schema: The arrow converted schema to destroy.

comment.description:
**DEPRECATION NOTICE**: This method is scheduled for removal in a future release.

Executes a SQL query within a connection and stores the full (materialized) result in an arrow structure.
If the query fails to execute, DuckDBError is returned and the error message can be retrieved by calling
`duckdb_query_arrow_error`.

Note that after running `duckdb_query_arrow`, `duckdb_destroy_arrow` must be called on the result object even if the
query fails, otherwise the error stored within the result will not be freed correctly.

param_comments.connection: The connection to perform the query in.

comment.description:
**DEPRECATION NOTICE**: This method is scheduled for removal in a future release.

Fetch the internal arrow schema from the arrow result. Remember to call release on the respective
ArrowSchema object.

param_comments.result: The result to fetch the schema from.

comment.description:
**DEPRECATION NOTICE**: This method is scheduled for removal in a future release.

Fetch the internal arrow schema from the prepared statement. Remember to call release on the respective
ArrowSchema object.

param_comments.prepared: The prepared statement to fetch the schema from.

comment.description:
**DEPRECATION NOTICE**: This method is scheduled for removal in a future release.

Convert a data chunk into an arrow struct array. Remember to call release on the respective
ArrowArray object.

param_comments.result: The result object the data chunk have been fetched from.

comment.description:
**DEPRECATION NOTICE**: This method is scheduled for removal in a future release.

Fetch an internal arrow struct array from the arrow result. Remember to call release on the respective
ArrowArray object.

This function can be called multiple time to get next chunks, which will free the previous out_array.
So consume the out_array before calling this function again.

param_comments.result: The result to fetch the array from.

comment.description:
**DEPRECATION NOTICE**: This method is scheduled for removal in a future release.

Returns the number of columns present in the arrow result object.
comment.return_value: The number of columns present in the result object.

comment.description:
**DEPRECATION NOTICE**: This method is scheduled for removal in a future release.

Returns the number of rows present in the arrow result object.
comment.return_value: The number of rows present in the result object.

comment.description:
**DEPRECATION NOTICE**: This method is scheduled for removal in a future release.

Returns the number of rows changed by the query stored in the arrow result. This is relevant only for
INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE queries. For other queries the rows_changed will be 0.

**DEPRECATION NOTICE**: This method is scheduled for removal in a future release.

 Returns the error message contained within the result. The error is only set if `duckdb_query_arrow` returns
`DuckDBError`.

The error message should not be freed. It will be de-allocated when `duckdb_destroy_arrow` is called.

param_comments.result: The result object to fetch the error from.

comment.description:
**DEPRECATION NOTICE**: This method is scheduled for removal in a future release.

Closes the result and de-allocates all memory allocated for the arrow result.

**DEPRECATION NOTICE**: This method is scheduled for removal in a future release.

Releases the arrow array stream and de-allocates its memory.

param_comments.stream_p: The arrow array stream to destroy.

comment.description:
**DEPRECATION NOTICE**: This method is scheduled for removal in a future release.

Executes the prepared statement with the given bound parameters, and returns an arrow query result.
Note that after running `duckdb_execute_prepared_arrow`, `duckdb_destroy_arrow` must be called on the result object.

**DEPRECATION NOTICE**: This method is scheduled for removal in a future release.

Scans the Arrow stream and creates a view with the given name.

param_comments.connection: The connection on which to execute the scan.
param_comments.table_name: Name of the temporary view to create.

comment.description:
**DEPRECATION NOTICE**: This method is scheduled for removal in a future release.

Scans the Arrow array and creates a view with the given name.
Note that after running `duckdb_arrow_array_scan`, `duckdb_destroy_arrow_stream` must be called on the out stream.

param_comments.connection: The connection on which to execute the scan.
param_comments.table_name: Name of the temporary view to create.
param_comments.out_stream: Output array stream that wraps around the passed schema, for releasing/deleting once done.
